FAQ / Wave 5 / Characters /
View On FortressMaximus.io

Optimus Prime - Legendary Warrior

  1. Canon-wise, which Heads go with which Bodies?
    While you are encouraged to mix and match your Head and Body Mode characters, their original pairings are:
    Autobots

    • Optimus Prime - Legendary Warrior → Apex
    • Autobot Nautica - Camien Engineer - → Parsec
    • Brainstorm - Biomechanical Engineer → Autobot Teslor or (Decepticon) Arcana
    • Chromedome - Computer Programmer → Autobot Stylor
    • Sergeant Kup - Wrecker Leader → Flintlock
    • Topspin - Air & Space Assault → Freezeout
    • Twin Twist - Demolitions → Flameout
    • Perceptor - Precise Sniper → Convex
    • Fortress Maximus - Great War Veteran → Cerebros
    • Cerebros - City Commander → Emissary

    Decepticons
    • Megatron - Fallen Hero → Doomshot
    • Decepticon Quake - Ground Assault → Chasm
    • Fangry - Sky Tracker → Brisko
    • Horri-Bull - Ground Trooper → Kreb
    • Mindwipe - Hypnotist → Vorath
    • Skullsmasher - Swamp Warrior → Grax
    • Wolfwire - Ground Tracker → Monxo
    • Sky Shadow - Elite Warrior → Ominus

    While Clobber looks like Grimlock's head, there's no canon (as yet) in which Clobber is his head.
  2. If Optimus - Legendary Warrior attacks in bot-mode with less characters than your opponent and you choose to repair a character upgraded with Toolbox, will you repair 4 because there are two times, or is it just 3 because it is one time repairing?
    It's repair 1 "then" repair 1. So Toolbox will change it to repair 2, then repair 2, for a total of 4.
    Sky Shadow
  3. How many stratagems can I play?
    You can play up to one stratagem for each different character, trait, or faction listed on the stratagem, as long as your starting team includes that character, trait, or faction. For example, if your starting team is all Autobots and includes Optimus Prime - Legendary Warrior, you can play both Heroic Spotlight and Duty & Honor.
